title: What are some examples of reductionism in biology? - Quora

response.answer_text: In simple reduction biology deals with the study of living world at its reduced form.Suppose you wanted to study biological/living world at taxonomic level i.e you will make your study on Species level or Genus level, Family level …..and so on..Here every level is a reduced form in taxonomic study ..And if you make your study on this Individual level i.e in reduced level then it will imply that you are dealing with reduction biology… Similarly in biology if you want to explain or study the living world or an organism at cellular level then you have to do it using cell biology and in turn you will be dealing with a reduced form of biology.. or reduction biology whatever you call… Like wise If you want to explain or study the living world or an organism at the level of gene then you have to put light on genetics and thus you will again encounter another reduced form of biology or reduction biology..

A theoretical approach that aims to explain all social or cultural phenomena in biological terms, denying them any causal autonomy. Twentieth-century incarnations of biological reductionism have relied to varying degrees on Darwin's theory of evolution and principles of natural selection.
